mxCell.value:
A1. Crew Quarters

Sirens blare around you. You open your eyes as your head throbs with pain. A trickle of blood runs down the left side of your face. Despite the pain radiating throughout your body, you stand up to assess the damage. Aside from a few objects scattered on the floor, your quarters appear to be fine. The ships is no longer moving, but the immediate cause is unknown. 

You could either check the engine room to look for a fault, or head to the cockpit to ask Captain Mazzone for a report.

What's your next move?

1. I should check for damage in the engine room.
2. I'll head to the cockpit for a damage report.

A2. Corridor E-1

You've decided the best course of action is to search for a mechanical fault. As you walk down Corridor E-1, you notice it is unusually silent; on any given day, this hall is bustling with crew activity. Alarmed, you look around and notice a haze settling in the hallway, the source of which appears to be coming from the entrance to the engine room. 

What do you want to do?

1. I'll reach into my pack for my respirator and see what the trouble is.
2. This is a bad idea, I'm no engineer. I'm heading to the cockpit.

A3. Crew Hall 4

Captain Mazzone will know why the ship stopped. You exit your quarters and make your way into Crew Hall 4. As the door slides shut behind you, your breath catches in your chest as you see the bodies of Corporal Jensen, Lieutenant Billups, and Staff Sergeant Briggs on the floor. 

Briggs takes in a deep, rasping breath and struggles to call your name. 

You rush across the hall to her, stumbling over Jensen's outstretched arm.

1. "Briggs, it's me! Are you okay?"

X2. It's a Trap!

As you attempt to remove the canister from the ventilation system, you hear a click followed by a rapid, high-pitched beeping sound. You take a step back, but it's too late. The control panel explodes and turns the engineering bay (and you) into star dust.

Would you like to try again?

1. Yes. (Return to title screen.)
2. No. (Quit.)

S1. Success State

(this leads to next part of the story, or is the win screen)

Story goes here.

1. Continue...

A4. Inside Job

"Do I look okay?" Briggs struggles to say. Her chest is vibrating with every word. "I doubt I have long so shut up and listen." 

She coughs violently and you notice blood slowly dribbling from the left side of her mouth.

"This wasn't an accident. We're being attacked from within the ship. Jensen noticed a thick gas pouring from the vents shortly before we made impact. I think someone is poisoning us."

How should you reply?

1. "That doesn't make sense, we'd know if this was an attack from within."
2. "A thick gas? Are you sure it wasn't just smoke from the impact?"

B1. Engine Room

Donning your respirator, you press forward into the engine room. A thick, orange fog surrounds you, obstructing your immediate surroundings; however, you hear a loud beeping sound to your left.

What's your next move, boss?

1. I need to follow the beep. That will lead me to the problem.
2. Seriously, I'm not an engineer. I'm ignoring the beep and looking for help.

B2. The Sabotaged Valve

As you press forward through the fog, you see a small control panel with a blinking red light. Though your area of expertise is medical, you immediately recognize that something is amiss. Attached to the control panel is a small canister leading down into the ship's ventilation system. This explains the orange haze surrounding the engineering bay.

Now what?

1. I need to go see if anyone else on the ship is alive before I touch this.
2. I have to remove the canister from the ventilation system to prevent any further casualties.

B3. Searching for Help

Donning your respirator, you press forward into the engine room. A thick, orange fog surrounds you, obstructing your immediate surroundings; however, you hear a loud beeping sound to your left.

What's your next move, boss?

1. I need to follow the beep. That will lead me to the problem.
2. Seriously, I'm not an engineer. I'm ignoring the beep and looking for help.

A5. Betrayal

"This was an attack, I know what smoke looks like and that wasn't smoke." She coughs more violently than before.

"Wait...how did you survive with nothing more than a scrape on your head? It...it was you, wasn't it? You're the one who sabotaged the ship! You're the Federation defector, aren't you?!"

She reaches to her hip and grips her pistol with what little strength she has and levels it toward your chest.

"I always knew something was off about you."

How do you proceed?

1. I should rush at her and tear the pistol from her grip. I can overpower her now.
2. I'll roll to my right and try to get behind some cover.

A6. Temporary Safety

You roll to the right and hide in the doorway to Billups' quarters as Briggs' blaster bolt misses wide. Sweat drips down the side of your face as Briggs calls back to you.

"Why'd you do it, traitor? What was your plan?"

1. "It wasn't me, Briggs! I was in my quarters and woke up after impact!"

X1. Too Slow

Despite her weakened state, Briggs hasn't lost a step with her blaster. As you rush toward her, Briggs fires and lands a direct hit on your chest. You collapse to the ground as Briggs takes aim to finish the job.

"I couldn't let you take any more lives, traitor."

With a gasping breath, you utter your final words...

1. "It...wasn't...me...loyal...to...empire...until...the...end..." (Start over.)
2. "Too bad...took you so...long to...figure me out...scum..." (Start over.)
